El caso es que quise alargarla, y la jefa de recepciÃ³n me tratÃ³ mal y me hechÃ³ diciendo que la habitaciÃ³n la habia reservado en solo mujeres y que no tenian hab mixtas, e hizo que el seguridad viniese conmigo a la habitaciÃ³n a recoger mis cosas como si hubiese hecho algo malo, el caso es que me metÃ­ en la web a reservar mixta y si que tenÃ­an habitaciÃ³n libre de hecho varias.. simplemente se le cruzÃ³ el cable y me tratÃ³ asÃ­, una pena porque el lugar estÃ¡ muy bien pero no volverÃ­a jamÃ¡s.

title: Todo perfecto - Excepto la recepciÃ³nâ€
content:
La Estructura es increÃ­ble, las zonas comunes parecen de un hotel. 
La posiciÃ³n estÃ¡ a mitad entre la playa y el centro de tulum, para moverte vas a necesitar una bicicleta, que puedes alquilar en en el mismo hostal por 220 pesos y varios sitios en la calle principal entre 150 y 250 pesos por las 24 horas.
El hostal tiene un bar y una piscina bastante grande con mucho sitio para tomar el sol, una sala comÃºn donde descansar, la cocina y una habitaciÃ³n para remote working. 
Las habitaciones son limpias y de calidad muy alta, con camas cÃ³modas y grandes, mucho espacio y taquillas enormes para guardar tus cosas.
El Ãºnico punto negativo es la recepciÃ³n, los trabajadores son poco amables, muy frÃ­os y poco dispuestos a ayudarte, si tienes alguna duda o necesitas informaciones de algÃºn tipo, te contestan casi siempre que â€œno sabenâ€, no es esto el espÃ­ritu de trabajar en un hostal!

hotel_name: ëˆ„ì— íˆ´ë£¸ (Nuee Tulum)
title: Gorgeous Room/Terribly Loudâ€
content:
Now, I want to preface this by saying that literally everything was great about the room and the staff. The only issue was the noise. Because of how the building was constructed you can hear EVERYTHING. Everything people are doing in the floors above and below, everything theyâ€™re saying and laughing about in the reception. All the doors getting slammed shut. Thereâ€™s even a bar or something next door just bumping music all night. Oh and the neighbors like to play the trumpet in the streets at night when they get drunk. 

No I know I sound like a Karen but Iâ€™ve been sleeping in party hostels for years and decided I wanted to go somewhere a little nicer so I could relax but I got pretty frustrated many times. You canâ€™t sleep in after 8 because of hotel and street noise. And if you have a night where youâ€™re trying to turn in before 11 then good luck. 

Also I will say, it could have just been my room and itâ€™s location experiencing all these issues, maybe a room higher in the hotel would be quieter? I was in the second floor so I heard the street and bc of the open walkway layout, I heard everyone arriving and leaving through the entrance. 

But yea, I had no other issues with this hotel or the room. Itâ€™s gorgeous and the staff were very nice and accommodating.

Pool/rooftop bar & food with loungers.
A great breakfast too.
Last but not least, the staff were wonderful, especially Omar.
Could not recommend enough.

title: Beautiful hotel on the beach  with lovely sea viewâ€
content:
Loved everything about this place. It was my 5th time in Playa and I stayed in very nice boutique hotels before but this exceeded all my expectations.
Location couldn't be better: just off the quinta avenida on the beach side.. all the rooms have spacious terraces with tables and hammocks which wee great for chilling out in the evening.. the rooms on the beach front are slightly more expensive but they have better sea view than the ones on the back..
it was my sister's birthday and when they heard about this they arranged a nice cake and they decorated the room with baloons and flowers.. a lovely touch!
staff were extremely polite and friendly and this is one of the few hotel in playa which has a pool right on the beach which was very welcome during those days when the sea was a bit rough.. 
overall it was great value for money and I will definitely reccomend it to all my friends and family..

content: Low maintenance, focus more on treating for insects especially for ants. Needs proper air conditioning units knowing Mexico is so freaking hot. Guest would use their hands to pick up the food and just stand there and eat. Needs air conditioning or better fans. Change the 2 reservations for restaurants policy because the buffet sucks. Needs to be more toddler friendly. Other than the pool, my 1 yr old didnâ€™t have anything else to do. More activities; this isnâ€™t an adults only resort. Very limited options all around. For it to be my first time in Mexico, staying at Maya was miserable and boring. I shouldnâ€™t have to pay so much extra to enjoy myself. I can jet ski/para sail in the US. So many other hidden fees. When did you ever have to pay to use the safe in a hotel/resort? $2 per day is a rip off. No English channels! Wi-fi is crap. The staff is nice

title: Be prepared for NOISE!â€
content:
Love this hotel and have stayed 3 times now. Lots of positives - the rooftop pool & staff up there (Brenda & Freddy) are a highlight along with the Mexican restaurant & lobby bar. Close proximity to walk to everything in Playa including the beach. Fantastic views from the rooftop too.

Be prepared for minimal sleep as this is a very noisy hotel & it should be disclosed at the time of booking. There are bars & clubs on every side that will keep you awake until around 1AM every night - room 3303 was terrible for noise.

Air con doesnâ€™t work properly & temperature doesnâ€™t drop even when you change the settings which makes it hard to sleep in the heat. Otherwise the rooms are great with heaps of space.

Check in staff are a bit vague & unhelpful but all other staff were fantastic and made our stay very enjoyable.

content: The hotel room is exactly as picture in the photos so thatâ€™s great, but thatâ€™s pretty much it.
